translations.text: Guided the sow to the wife
Brought the pig out of the wood
Tied Dianka to the tip of the tail
Grabbed the boar by the fangs
Grabbed the boar by the horns
Hammered his tusks into the tree
Brought a tree on a boar
The wind threw up your gun
A lumberjack came, cut down a tree and you took the gun
An earthquake ad thrown off your gun
Magpie had thrown off your gun
Made some antlers and challenged him on a duel
To get seven little goats out
To grab something inside and pull out it
Threw a fur cloak on the dog
Threw a fur cloak on the bypasser
to sew a waistcoat from she
to carve dog's name on a cane
Made a grandiose entrance into the yard
Circled the estate thirty times on it
Hid yourself in the same cloud
Dug a grave for the horse
Sent a servant for a farrier
Packed the horse with hay, smeared with tar, and glued both halfs together
Charged the cannon with a canister shot
Threw all the cannons in the water
to pierce a had, inflate it and fly away
A wolf in a sledge harness
Pull a fur coat on it
Hit yourself in the right eye
Made a fishing rod with bacon on the end of it
Carefully dived into the lake and swum to ducks under the water
Put  some ducks into the hunting bag
Climbed on the ducks using the string and directed them down
Politely asked the ducks to go down
Let your wife take the lead
The second case with the Bear
by hoisting the boy on shoulders
by ordering all of them to carry the child together
In the carriage to fly off and Vasily the unbeliever
Sit on a cask and floated by the river
Scared by a sudden smacking of the belt
Threw a stone with a belt
With the sacred belt buckle ordained the horse as a Baron Stallion
